Package dnl

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • dnl.Network
  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents and stores the entire network, including the sets of Nodes and Links. Generally, this will be the go-to class for dealing with the network as a whole. The easiest way to construct a new Network is to create an instance of ReadNetwork, then call ReadNetwork.createNetwork(String) with the name of the network folder. To calculate the state of the network at the next timestep, call nextTimestep(). There are also methods to get the sets of Nodes and Links, and the specific Node or Link with a given id.

      Constructs the Network with the given Node and Link.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Network

        public Network​(java.lang.String name,
               java.util.List<Node> nodes,
               java.util.List<Link> links)
        Constructs the Network with the given Node and Link. In general, the easiest way to construct a Network will be to create a new ReadNetwork instance, then call ReadNetwork.createNetwork(String) with the name of the network folder.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of the network

      • getNodes

        public java.util.List<Node> getNodes()
        Returns:
        the set of all Nodes

      • getLinks

        public java.util.List<Link> getLinks()
        Returns:
        the set of all Links

      • getNode

        public Node getNode​(int id)
        Finds the Node with the given id. If none exists, returns null.

      • getLink

        public Link getLink​(int id)
        Finds the Link with the given id. If none exists, returns null.

      • getLink

        public Link getLink​(Node i,
                    Node j)
        Returns:
        the Link between the given Nodes, or null if none exists.

      • autograde

        public double autograde​(java.io.File solutions)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method does the same work as simulate() but records the exiting vehicles from each Sink node for autograding.
        Returns:
        proportion of correct answers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • printAutograde

        public void printAutograde​(java.io.File output)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • simulate

        public void simulate()
        This method simulates traffic flow from the current time to Params.DURATION. Calculates the link travel times using Link.calculateTravelTime(). It calls nextTimestep() for each time step.

      • nextTimestep

        public void nextTimestep()
        This method calculates the state of the network at the next time step. First, it calls Link.step() and Node.step() on all Nodes and Links. Then, it calls Link.update() and Node.update() on all Nodes and Links. Nodes and Links should implement step() and update() according to their specific traffic flow behavior.

      • dijkstras

        public void dijkstras​(Node dest)
        Runs one-to-all shortest path rooted at the specified destination node. This method sets the Node shortest path labels, Node.cost and Node.pred.

      • trace

        public Path trace​(Node origin,
                  Node dest)
        After running dijkstras(Node), this method is used to find the shortest path between an origin and a destination.

      • shortestPath

        public Path shortestPath​(Node origin,
                         Node dest)
        This method calls dijkstras(Node) then trace(Node, Node) to find the shortest path between two Nodes.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the network for the next simulation. Calls Node.reset() and Link.reset() for all nodes and links.

      • msa

        public void msa​(int num_iterations)
        Uses the method of successive averages to solve dynamic traffic assignment. Assumption: only one destination node (Sink node) exists in this network.
        Parameters:
        num_iterations - the number of iterations

      • msa_iteration

        public double msa_iteration​(double lambda,
                            Sink dest)

      • calculateGap

        public double calculateGap​(Sink dest)

      • getSPTT

        public double getSPTT​(Sink dest)
        Returns:
        the shortest path TSTT possible if travel times are equal to the current shortest paths.

      • getTSTT

        public double getTSTT()
